availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Clark (Pendleton County, KY, tavern keeper and druggist)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, tavern keeper and druggist. Ohio native. Son of C. B. Clark and Mary A. Clark. Student in Cincinnati, Ohio, in 1850. Druggist in Cincinnati in 1860. Tavern keeper in Pendleton County, Kentucky, in 1862. Served in the 7th Wisconsin Volunteer Infantry Regiment as private and corporal.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 8, p. 459B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 1, p. 81.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Wisconsin, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M559, Roll 05.
